title: Felt redemption of consciousness, say foreign pilgrims after Amarnath shrine ‘darshan’

title: Global childhood vaccination slowed by pandemic: study

title: IIT Guwahati team gives bamboo an automobile-ready touch
content: Combined with biodegradable polymers, the fast-growing Bambusa tulda has potential applications in automobiles and packaging, researchers said

title: A.P. Governor advocates cultivation of oilseeds, pulses to check malnutrition in country
content: Andhra Pradesh was a leading performer with a Compound Annual Growth Rate of 8.8% in agriculture and allied sectors in 2024-25 fiscal year, says Nazeer

title: TDP, BJP leaders submit memoranda to CEO on strengthening the electoral process
content: Among others, they suggest that death details be gathered from local bodies at regular interval and voter lists updated accordingly, zero door number system be avoided, and schools / colleges be made voter enrollment hubs

title: IMD issues ‘heavy to very heavy rainfall’ warning for North Coastal Andhra Pradesh till July 27
content: Low-pressure area forms over north Bay of Bengal, and it is likely to become well marked and move towards West Bengal and North Odisha, says IMD

title: Rajasthan considering establishment of “risk relief fund” for farmers
content: The fund is to resolve the financial difficulties faced by them because of high premium charged by crop insurance companies

title: Modi leaves for Maldives after concluding U.K. trip
content: Mr. Modi was hosted by his U.K. counterpart, Keir Starmer for an intense session of talks that also covered regional and global issues of mutual interest

title: Indian students flagged difficulty in obtaining U.S. student visa appointments: Govt to Parliament
content: Govt said the MEA took up the matter with the U.S. Embassy in New Delhi as well as the U.S. Department of State

title: India, U.S. presently engaged in active negotiations on Bilateral Trade Agreement: Govt in Parliament
content: Both sides acknowledged the importance of "maintaining positive momentum" in these negotiations and expressed their commitment to an early conclusion of the first tranche of a mutually beneficial, multi-sector BTA, Govt said

title: Mandatory to immerse Plaster of Paris (PoP) Ganesh idols up to 6 ft in artificial ponds only, says Bombay HC
content: The order will be effective till March next year for the festivals that have the custom of immersing deities’ idols in Maharashtra

title: Operation Sindoor: India's actions were measured, non-escalatory, govt tells Parliament
content: Minster of State for External Affairs Kirti Vardhan Singh said said Operation Sindoor was launched to respond to a "barbaric cross-border terror attack by Pakistan-sponsored terrorists

title: V.S. Achuthanandan, the man of the masses
content: Had it not been for him, many cases and issues deserving public attention and debate would have easily gone under the carpet

title: Central govt. officials petition Cabinet Secretary, PMO on career stagnation
content: In its appeal to the Prime Minister, forum seeks fresh cadre review, initiation of time-bound promotions, and service parity with other Central Civil Services

title: Stop unlawful deportation of Bengali Muslims, Human Rights Watch tells government
content: To garner political support, BJP-run States have rounded up Muslims, mostly impoverished migrant workers, and turned them over to Indian border security personnel, it says

title: NGO members assaulted in Indore over suspicion of religious conversion
content: Right-wing activists attack Howl Group members during a press conference called by them to counter the “misinformation campaign” against it

title: One killed in Jammu shootout
content: The J&K Police has not issued any statement about the incident. Official sources said it took place when the police were chasing suspected drug peddlers in the area

title: Assertions like ‘J&K is illegally occupied’, ‘should separate from India’ attract UAPA sections: J&K High Court
content: The trial court was of the view that since the respondents were merely raising slogans with no activity of inciting violence, “Section 13 was not applicable”

title: The fault lines in India’s electoral architecture are visible
content: The Bihar poll rolls revision only strengthens the point that the Election Commission of India must back alternative models of enrolment

title: Home Minister to move statutory resolution in Parliament to extend President’s Rule in Manipur
content: Shah’s notice was admitted for Thursday but the House was adjourned around 2.15 p.m. following protest by the Opposition against the Election Commission’s SIR process in Bihar

title: Walking into a death trap
content: Illegal electric snares set up by farmers to ward off wild animals claimed two lives, one a 15-year-old, in the past two months in different parts of Kerala. Farmers are required to seek permission before installing electric traps, but that stipulation is seldom abided by. They just focus on crop protection, using the cheapest option available. Sam Paul A. gives an overall picture

title: Myanmar junta claims recapture of gold mining town, Thabeikkyin
content: A civil war has consumed Myanmar since a 2021 coup deposed the civilian government, with the military battling a myriad of pro-democracy guerrillas and ethnic armed organisations.

title: Collector visits school, dines with students
content: Mr. Lakshmisha enquired with the students about quality of food and explained to them about cyber frauds

title: Honey trap row: BJP Minister questions Sharad Pawar and Eknath Khadse’s connection with the accused
content: Taking to social media, he highlighted that when the Opposition was in power, “they attempted to implicate” him in false crimes

title: SC reserves verdict on State government’s challenge on Kannada actor’s bail
content: The Bench was hearing a plea filed by the State against the High Court’s December 13, 2024 verdict granting bail to Mr. Darshan and co-accused

title: 11th edition of Malabar River Festival to begin in Kozhikode on July 25
content: Competitions to take place on Iruvazhinjipuzha and Chalippuzha; Public Works Minister to inaugurate closing ceremony on July 27, 2025

title: No safety audit yet despite rise in incidents of drowning in Kozhikode
content: Safety and surveillance measures remain ignored near risky waterbodies, public ponds, and water tourism destinations

title: 17 tourists rescued after harrowing night in Odisha Forest
content: They battle heavy rain, pitch darkness, and the chilly wind atop 3,000-foot altitude in Gandhamardhan hill

title: Utpal Kumar Singh to take over as CEO of Sansad TV
content: Mr. Singh will replace Rajit Punhani, a 1991 IAS officer of Bihar cadre, who was appointed as the CEO of Sansad TV during former Vice-President Jagdeep Dhankhar’s chairmanship

title: GST notices to traders: A fiasco that could have been avoided with feet on ground
content: Before issuing notices to the traders, a spot visit to assess the nature of business should have been undertaken, say sources

title: Bengali migrants not under attack; Mamata  inciting conflict to garner votes: Mithun Chakraborty
content: This development comes days after Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee announced a language movement to protest against reported attacks on Bengali-speaking migrant workers

title: Decoding ECI’s counter affidavit on SIR | Explained
content: What has the Election Commission of India argued in its counter affidavit filed in the Supreme Court? Why is seeking a citizenship test through the Special Intensive Revision exercise in Bihar problematic? What are the legal and logistical challenges involved?

title: Telangana caste survey a RARE model for India and Sonia’s letter a Nobel prize: Revanth Reddy
content: The Chief Minister attributed the success to Mr. Gandhi and said that February 4, when the survey started last year, would be celebrated as Social Justice Day in Telangana.

title: Detentions and torture of Bengali migrants increasing: Mamata
content: The West Bengal Chief Minister accused the Union government of spreading “linguistic terror”; she said that from “July 27, a movement will start in Bengal in protest against the attack on Bengalis, Bengali language”

title: ₹375 crore worth tourism projects sanctioned for A.P. in 2024-25: Union Tourism Minister Shekhawat
content: Projects at Suryalanka beach, Borra Caves, Gandikota and Rajamahendravaram get major allocations, Gajendra Singh Shekhawat mentions in a written response in the Rajya Sabha

title: A.P. overdrawing Tungabhadra water, TG tells tribunal
content: Telangana urges Brijesh Kumar Tribunal to allocate savings based on crop water requirement to its in-basin projects

title: Mohan Bhagwat meets Muslims religious leaders in Delhi to promote dialogue between communities
content: Ahmed Ilyasi, chief imam of the All India Imam Organisation (AIIO), said 60 Muslim leaders held a discussion with the RSS chief on ways to ‘end hatred’

title: A writer creates a work, but a translator breathes new life into it, says writer Imayam
content: Mr. Imayam was in conversation with Justice (retired) Prabha Sridevan, former judge of the Madras High Court, who has translated three of his books into English, at The Hindu office in Chennai.

title: Five IAS officers undertake to visit old age homes & orphanages to purge themselves from contempt proceedings before Madras High Court
content: Justice Battu Devanand records the written undertaking given by the officers to spend time with the inmates and arrange lunch/dinner for them out of personal funds

title: Rowdy sheeter murder case transferred to CID
content: According to police sources, the case was transferred due to multiple reasons, including the suspected involvement of influential people

title: Low cancer rate in A.P. prompts govt. to go for another exclusive survey
content: Results of NCD Survey-3 showed that only 0.35% of the screened people were diagnosed cancer, which is low when compared to the incidence of the disease in the country, says Minister for Health, Medical Education and Family Welfare Satya Kumar Yadav

title: Rahul Gandhi granted bail in Savarkar defamation case
content: Rahul Gandhi has also appealed in the Nashik Sessions Court against the issuing of process by the additional chief judicial magistrate. The appeal will be heard next month

title: Opposition to opt for consensus candidate in V-P election unlike 2022
content: Trinamool and AAP abstained from the 2022 election after Congress went against the broader agreement and fielded party veteran Margaret Alva; 55 members stayed away from that election

title: Mother of stampede victim files theft case
content: In her complaint, Ashwini said that the earrings, which were gifted by her brother to Divyanshi a year and a half ago, were found missing when the body was handed over to her

title: Dalits, Adivasis, and women at core of new cooperation policy of Centre, says Amit Shah
content: Cooperatives will help people achieve aspirations requiring capital, says Mr. Shah; Ministry has made detailed plans for cooperatives in taxi services, insurance, tourism, and green energy sectors

title: Rameshwaram Cafe files complaint about blackmail and extortion
content: The cafe said that earlier there were several attempts where people with malafide intentions voluntarily put insects, stones in the food, and were caught red handed in some of their other outlets

title: After Giridhari, JD(U) MLA opposes ongoing SIR in Bihar
content: AIMIM MLA Aktharul Iman raises concern over alleged discrimination against the Muslim population in the Seemanchal region, terms SIR as EC’s Tughlaqi farman

title: Government to notify regulations for vegetable oil products
content: Union Food Minister Pralhad Joshi was addressing a round-table meeting organised by the Indian Vegetable Oil Producers’ Association

title: Committee to look into ‘legal structure’ for India Meteorological Department
content: Despite being the official source of monsoon forecasts, cyclone warnings, and all aspects involving weather, there is no single law that defines the structure, function and responsibilities of the IMD

title: PIL filed to bring Sarasvati Mahal Library under national mission
content: Petitionery says the library is languishing under administrative neglect, staff shortage, unimplemented digitisation, and because of lack of preservation efforts

title: Cabinet directs action on two officials for Tirupati stampede
content: It approves the one-man panel report on the incident; clears various proposals related to BC Welfare Dept., Tourism, Agriculture and road works in Amaravati

title: Gang involved in series of palladium carbon theft across country caught by Sangareddy police
content: Approximately 38 kilograms of palladium carbon, a mild hydrogenation catalyst, worth ₹1.52 crore was seized from the three-member gang.

title: Operation Sindoor fallout: Chinese-made surveillance gear banned, aerial monitoring boosted for Independence Day
content: Defence Ministry took over Red Fort venue on July 15; radar, anti-drone systems to be deployed as UAVs, UAS are a key security concern; CCTV vendors directed not to install equipment made in China

title: McGee's Mascot Power Rankings: The best of the fun and furry in college football
content: From giant red blobs and 1,700-pound steer to coonskin caps and bears riding Harleys, these are the sport's top merrymakers.

title: Pro wrestling legend Hulk Hogan dies at age 71
content: Hulk Hogan, an icon in the world of professional wrestling, has died at the age of 71, Florida police and WWE said Thursday.

title: Kansas' Self hospitalized, has 2 stents inserted
content: Kansas coach Bill Self was hospitalized Thursday after experiencing "some concerning symptoms" and had two stents inserted. The school said he was expected to make a full recovery.

title: Raiders releasing Wilkins; NFLPA files grievance
content: The Raiders have informed defensive tackle Christian Wilkins that he has been released. The NFLPA has filed a grievance on his behalf after the $35.2M of guaranteed money left on his contract was voided last month.

title: Mariners land slugging 1B Naylor from D-backs
content: The Mariners bolstered their efforts to return to the playoffs by acquiring slugger Josh Naylor from the Diamondbacks on Thursday night.

title: Rodgers opens with pick: Got it out of the way
content: Quarterback Aaron Rodgers said his interception wasn't a bad omen for his Steelers tenure, saying, "I'm going to throw some touchdowns, too," and expressing optimism about the team's Super Bowl hopes.

title: Trump issues executive order for college sports
content: President Donald Trump has directed members of his Cabinet to develop a plan in the next 30 days aimed at preserving college sports opportunities and preventing college athletes from becoming professionals.

title: Kuminga in no rush to accept Warriors' offers
content: Restricted free agent Jonathan Kuminga is in no rush to sign the latest contract offers from the Golden State Warriors, he told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: Michigan DE slights Ohio St. title: 'Didn't beat us'
content: Michigan's Derrick Moore scoffed at rival Ohio State's national title last season, saying, "It's not a real win if y'all didn't beat us."

title: 📈 MLB Power Rankings: NL team debuts at No. 1
content:
Our first list of the second half sees a massive shake-up in the top five, with three clubs at their highest rankings of the seasons -- including a new squad at the top.

content: Let's run through the people in the NFL who have the most to gain or lose this season, in terms of new contracts or new jobs.

content: ESPN's Jeremy Woo polled executives and scouts on the incoming rookie class. Who will win ROY? Which players will surpass expectations?

content: As CBA negotiations continue, WNBA players made a unified statement at the All-Star Game. Here's how they landed on "Pay Us What You Owe Us" shirts.

title: How the Valkyries have exceeded all expectations -- even their own
content: Expansion franchises have historically struggled in Year 1. But Golden State is fighting for a WNBA playoff spot.

content: From his "whys" to his "life license plate," Schottenheimer explains his ink and what he'll do if he wins a Super Bowl.

content: Which offseason acquisitions and draft picks will have the most impact at their new destinations in Year 1?

title: Pete Rose history on display at Baseball Hall of Fame
content: The National Baseball Hall of Fame and Museum's archives contain dozens of items related to MLB's hits king.

title: In the wake of tragedy, can Liverpool win a second straight Premier League title?
content: Diogo Jota's death casts an immense shadow over Liverpool's preseason preparations, but new arrivals have strengthened the squad. Could the Reds win the Premier League title again?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea join Liverpool in Isak pursuit
content: Newcastle United striker Alexander Isak is open to leaving this summer, with Liverpool and Chelsea keen. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

content: Let's take a look into the crystal ball to tell fantasy baseball managers what might come to pass in the not-too-distant future.

content: The top signal-callers went early and quality wide receivers remained available in the middle rounds.

content: Players are looking to learn from the mistakes that led them to hire ex-NFLPA executive director Lloyd Howell Jr.

title: Chiefs' Travis Kelce shows out in training camp ahead of 'Happy Gilmore 2' cameo
content: The Kansas City Chiefs tight end had an impressive Day 2 of training camp before his "Happy Gilmore 2" appearance premieres.

title: No Messi, no Alba: Can the MLS All-Star Game be fixed, and where does it go from here?
content: With some of the league's biggest stars absent, MLS must find a way to boost the profile of the All-Star Game.

title: England's savior Agyemang embracing super-sub role, but what's next for her?
content: Michelle Agyemang's breakout Euro 2025 has helped England reach the final, but what lessons can she learn from teammates and Spain's young talent?

title: Preview, times, predictions, stats and fun facts
content: Formula 1 heads to Spa-Francorchamps for round 13 of the 2025 season. Find out the stats, session times and predictions for the weekend.

title: PLL Power Rankings entering Week 9: Outlaws, Atlas stay on top
content: While the top three squads from last week's power rankings remain steady, the Whipsnakes have moved up to the No. 4 spot.

title: 2K details reveal roadmap for NBA 2K26
content: Here's the schedule for all upcoming reveals and announcements for the upcoming basketball simulation.

title: Few lament his absence: It's 'business-as-usual' for parties, Dhankhar now marooned in a political no man's land
content: Jagdeep Dhankhar's abrupt resignation as Vice President, ostensibly due to health reasons, has been met with muted reactions from both the government and opposition. Dhankhar's acceptance of an opposition motion against Justice Yashwant Varma triggered a no-confidence threat from the NDA, leading to his swift departure. Political circles are now focused on his replacement, with Dhankhar seemingly isolated after the controversial decision.

title: How past FTAs shaped UK deal & how UK agreement will change past pacts
content: India's recent free trade agreements with the UK, Australia, and the UAE are setting precedents for future negotiations. Concessions like reduced auto tariffs and government procurement access are becoming baselines. However, India is resisting pressure to open its agricultural market, particularly dairy, to protect its farmers, potentially impacting existing trade deals with ASEAN, Japan, and South Korea.

title: Can't lower age of consent from 18, govt tells SC
content: The Union government has informed the Supreme Court that lowering the age of consent from 18 is not feasible, emphasizing its role in safeguarding minors from sexual abuse, often within trusted environments. While advocating for strict enforcement to uphold child protection laws, the Centre acknowledged judicial discretion in adolescent romantic relationships. Data indicates most offenses are by known individuals, making consent a problematic defense.

title: IND vs ENG: ‘Playing through pain’ - Tendulkar lauds Pant’s gritty fifty in Manchester
content: Rishabh Pant displayed remarkable resilience during the fourth Test against England, battling a toe injury to score a courageous fifty. His innings, filled with boundaries and sixes, not only matched a significant record but also surpassed MS Dhoni in 50+ scores for Indian wicketkeepers.

title: Thailand-Cambodia border clashes: 14 dead, over 100k flee amid violence
content: Escalating clashes between Thai and Cambodian forces along their disputed border have resulted in at least 14 fatalities and displaced over 100,000 civilians. The intense fighting, involving various weaponry, marks the most serious confrontation in over a decade, prompting international concern and a UN Security Council session.

title: Trump: Everyone is saying I will destroy Musk's companies, but this is not so...
content: Donald Trump has denied claims that he intends to harm Elon Musk's companies or eliminate their government subsidies, emphasizing his desire for all US businesses to prosper. This statement follows escalating tensions between the two figures, sparked by Musk's opposition to Trump's spending bill and the resurfacing of Trump's connection to Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Cricket | 'Upwards of Rs ...' — Shastri reveals how much India's stars really earn
content: Former India head coach Ravi Shastri revealed that top Indian cricketers like Virat Kohli, MS Dhoni and Sachin Tendulkar earn upwards of 100 crore rupees (10 million pounds) annually through endorsements. These superstars command massive brand deals, leveraging their immense popularity akin to global icons like Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo.

title: Donald Trump signs NIL executive order: Crackdown on pay-for-play in college sports
content: President Donald Trump signed an executive order on July 24, 2025, aiming to regulate name, image, and likeness (NIL) deals in college sports. The order bans third-party "pay-for-play" payments while allowing fair endorsements. It also mandates increased scholarship support for women’s and non-revenue sports at wealthier athletic departments, addressing concerns about competitive balance.

title: There may be a swing or a miss, but we play with straight bat: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Modi emphasized that the CETA agreement will significantly improve market access for Indian textiles, seafood, and engineering goods in the UK, benefiting India's youth and MSME sector. The agreement will also make UK medical devices and aerospace components more accessible in India. Furthermore, the Double Contribution Convention will ease the burden on Indian employees working temporarily in the UK.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: Don't feel sad for my employees; I’ve made billionaires..
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang boasts of creating numerous billionaires within his management team, attributing it to the success of focused AI research teams. He highlighted the significant impact of smaller, well-funded teams, citing examples like OpenAI and DeepSeek.

title: AI171 crash fallout: Pilots call in sick; DGCA issues circular on mental health
content: Following the AI-171 crash on June 12, Air India has seen a spike in pilot sick leaves, prompting DGCA intervention. On June 16, 112 Air India pilots reported sick, raising concerns about mental wellbeing. MoS for civil aviation Murlidhar Mohol addressed the issue in Lok Sabha, highlighting DGCA's medical circular on mental health for flight crews and air traffic controllers.

title: Stop building in China, hiring in India, Trump warns tech majors
content: President Trump has urged American tech companies to prioritize hiring in the US, aiming to curb overseas job creation in countries like India and China. Speaking at an AI summit, he criticized "radical globalism" and called for a shift towards national loyalty within Silicon Valley. Trump's remarks signal a push to reclaim US dominance in AI, prompting concerns within the tech industry regarding global operations and supply chains.

title: World's largest asset manager BlackRock sends 'China diktat' to employees
content: BlackRock is restricting employees' use of company-issued devices in China due to rising US-China tensions and data security concerns. Staff must now use temporary loaner phones and cannot use company laptops, reflecting broader anxieties about operating in China's complex regulatory environment. This follows incidents of Western business executives facing travel restrictions and stricter data security laws.

title: RCB, Karnataka cricket body to face action for stampede
content: The Karnataka government has decided to pursue legal action based on a report indicting RCB, KSCA, and DNA Entertainment Networks for a fatal stampede outside Chinnaswamy Stadium. DNA Entertainment has challenged the report, citing procedural lapses and arguing against liability for crowd management outside the venue. The D'Cunha commission has identified several individuals from these organizations as responsible for the incident, while multiple inquiries are underway.

title: Trexit: Tariffs eliminated on 99% Indian exports to UK
content: India and the UK have formalized a Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement after three years of negotiations, aiming to more than double bilateral trade to $56 billion by 2030. The agreement slashes duties on various goods, benefiting consumers with cheaper British products like cars and Scotch. In return, the UK will allow zero-duty import on 99% of Indian product lines.

title: 3 years, 14 rounds: Deal clinched hours before start of Sindoor
content: India's trade deal with the UK, initiated 18 years ago, gained momentum post-Brexit and India's RCEP exit. Reviving dormant talks, the Modi government aimed to tap developed markets like the UK and EU. Boris Johnson's initial push faced setbacks with his resignation, compounded by UK's internal uncertainties and visa concerns.

title: Ciara and baby Amora twin in adorable photo: Fans gush over sweet moment
content: Ciara and Russell Wilson's daughter, Amora Princess, is growing up. A recent photo shows Amora resembles her father, Russell Wilson. The family celebrated milestones, including Sienna's birthday and their 9th anniversary. Russell Wilson transitioned to the New York Giants. Ciara shares glimpses of Amora. The Wilsons balance family, fame, and football. They co-parent Future with unity.

title: Supreme Court stays Mumbai blasts verdict, accused won’t be rearrested
content: The Supreme Court has suspended the Bombay High Court's decision to acquit all 12 individuals implicated in the 2006 Mumbai train bombings. While the accused will remain free, the ruling will not set a precedent due to concerns about its impact on other MCOCA cases. The court issued notices to the accused, seeking their responses to the government's appeal against the acquittal.

title: Travis Kelce & Taylor Swift share unseen romantic moments
content: Travis Kelce has shared photos with Taylor Swift on Instagram. This marks a new step in their relationship. The post shows their time together. They have been on trips and spent time with family. Fans noticed they have the same phone lock screen photo. Sources say they are happy. Swift will support Kelce during the NFL season.

title: Who is Hulk Hogan’s wife Sky Daily? 25-yr age gap, yoga to wedding — love story decoded
content: Hulk Hogan, the wrestling icon, married Sky Daily in September 2023, marking his third marriage. Their relationship, which began in 2022, has drawn attention due to their 25-year age gap. Despite family drama involving Hogan's ex-wife and daughter, the couple remains focused on their shared faith and fitness, solidifying their bond.

title: Saiyaara day 7: Ahaan-Aneet film hits Rs 170 cr; beats Rocky Aur Rani at box office
content: Mohit Suri's 'Saiyaara,' starring Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, continues its impressive box office performance, grossing over ₹170 crore in its first week. The film's success, fueled by positive reviews and social media buzz, allowed it to surpass 'Rocky Aur Rani Kii Prem Kahani's' lifetime collection. Suri expressed gratitude to Sandeep Reddy Vanga for his early support of the film.

title: Gabrielle Union opens up — miscarried while filming and 'just kept going' — personal heartbreak shared
content: Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union are cherishing family time with their daughter, Kaavia, after a challenging year that included Wade's kidney surgery. Union recently shared her past struggles with miscarriages, including a particularly difficult experience while filming 'Being Mary Jane.' The couple, who married in 2014, faced fertility issues and ultimately welcomed Kaavia via surrogacy.

title: Rahul Gandhi's 'vote theft' claim an afterthought, says EC
content: The Election Commission of India refuted Rahul Gandhi's allegations of vote theft in the 2024 Karnataka elections, highlighting Congress's failure to file appeals or challenge results in court. The EC and Karnataka CEO dismissed Gandhi's claims as baseless, noting the availability of electoral roll revisions and appeal processes. Amidst these accusations, concerns about voter list integrity and potential election boycotts have surfaced.

title: ED searches 35 premises linked to Anil Ambani
content: The ED conducted searches on Anil Ambani's premises and Reliance ADAG entities in Mumbai, investigating alleged money laundering involving ₹20-30,000 crore siphoned off from public sector banks. A mysterious entity, 'C Company,' is under scrutiny for related party transactions. The probe involves loan fraud, diversion of funds, and alleged bribery related to Yes Bank loans.

title: Belichick–Hudson relationship might shift as UNC weighs major decision about her
content: Bill Belichick's girlfriend, Jordon Hudson, is reportedly banned from the University of North Carolina's football facilities, according to sources. This decision by the athletic department follows concerns about Hudson's involvement in Belichick's work. Despite the controversy and rumors of engagement, Belichick and Hudson have not commented and continue to be seen together.

title: India, UK unveil road map to boost defence, tech, energy ties
content: Prime Minister Modi addressed critical issues with his UK counterpart, including the need for unified action against terrorism and the extradition of Indian economic offenders. They launched Vision 2035, a roadmap to enhance collaboration in defense, technology, and education. Both leaders emphasized strengthening multilateral institutions and committed to a fair global trading system, reinforcing their partnership.

title: Kuminga eyed in sign‑and‑trade by Suns & Kings: Delays Warriors deal — NBA suitors emerge
content: Golden State Warriors forward Jonathan Kuminga's future is uncertain as he explores options this summer. Restricted free agent Kuminga is reportedly drawing interest from the Phoenix Suns and Sacramento Kings, who have presented the Warriors with trade proposals. Kuminga is said to be seeking a larger role, potentially influencing his decision.

title: Should we allow bogus votes, CEC Gyanesh Kumar asks opposition
content: Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar defended the ongoing Special Summary Revision (SIR) of Bihar's electoral rolls amidst opposition criticism, questioning whether the EC should permit fraudulent votes. The EC reported 61.1 lakh electors in Bihar as 'not found,' including deceased, migrated, or duplicate voters. With 99% of electors covered and forms being digitized, the draft roll will be published on August 1 for review.

title: With zero duty access, India eyes boom in key exports
content: India's new trade pact with the UK aims to significantly boost its exports by targeting labor-intensive sectors. The agreement promises zero or near-zero tariffs on key items like textiles, leather, engineering goods, chemicals, and pharmaceuticals, enhancing India's competitiveness. With 99% of trade items covered, India anticipates outperforming competitors in textiles and footwear.

title: Visa boost for desi professionals, chefs in trade agreement
content: The India-UK trade agreement promises a more predictable visa regime for Indian professionals and business visitors, including senior executives, musicians, chefs, and yoga teachers. The UK will grant visas for up to three years for senior executives and 1,800 annual visas for specific professionals, while closely monitoring eligibility. The deal also promotes mutual recognition of academic qualifications and opens up sectors for both countries.

title: 'Secular' and 'socialist' will remain in Preamble: Government
content: The government has clarified that it has no intention to remove "socialist" and "secular" from the Constitution's preamble, despite ongoing debates. Law Minister Arjun Ram Meghwal stated that no formal legal or constitutional process has been initiated. This position contrasts with the RSS's call to remove the terms, which were added during the Emergency, a stance also supported by former Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar.

title: Duty cuts on UK goods may aid firms more than buyers
content: The Indian government has agreed to reduce tariffs on various UK imports, including chocolates, cosmetics, cars, and alcohol. While customs duties will decrease, the ultimate price reduction for consumers may be limited due to additional local levies and company margins. Competition and future trade agreements will also influence pricing strategies across sectors like automobiles and cosmetics.

title: ‘Did you meet Trump in presence of underage girls?’: Epstein dodges question in resurfaced video
content: A 2010 video shows Jeffrey Epstein refusing to answer questions about Donald Trump and underage girls. He cited his Fifth Amendment rights. The video has resurfaced recently. Epstein and Trump were once close but had a falling out. Epstein faced sex offense charges in 2006 and 2019. He died in jail.

title: Pharma, medical device sectors receive right prescription
content: The India-UK FTA is poised to bolster pharmaceutical and medical device supply chains, enhancing access to affordable medicines and fostering collaboration in bulk drugs and joint research. The agreement is expected to boost India's generic drug exports to the UK, currently valued at $1 billion. The medical devices industry anticipates accelerated bilateral trade, emphasizing the need for streamlined regulatory approvals and stricter Rules of Origin checks.

title: 2006 Mumbai train blasts: ‘ATS ruined my life,’ says doc out of prison after 19 years
content: Dr. Tanvir Ansari was released after being acquitted in the Mumbai train bombing case. He spent 19 years in jail. Ansari claims he was wrongly accused and tortured by the ATS. He says the real culprits are still free. He recalls the pain of not being able to treat his mother. Ansari completed degrees while incarcerated. He seeks help in finding a job after his life was ruined.

title: ‘I’d fire him’: Trump takes shots at Powell while standing beside him during Fed visit; watch video
content: Donald Trump visited the Federal Reserve renovation site. He attacked Jerome Powell regarding rising costs. The project's budget increased from $1.9 billion to $2.5 billion. Trump suggested firing Powell over the budget issues. He also pushed for interest rate cuts. Trump believes high rates are hindering home purchases. The Fed is likely to maintain current rates next week.

title: Britain deal eases costs, lifts mobility for Indian techies
content: The UK-India Double Contributions Convention provides significant relief to Indian IT firms by eliminating dual social security contributions for up to 36 months. This exemption reduces assignment costs and ensures continuity of coverage in India. The agreement addresses a long-standing demand, offering strong support to both individuals and businesses amid increasing protectionism.

title: Blast survivors still hopeful guilty will be punished by apex court
content: Survivors of the 11/7 Mumbai train blasts expressed mixed reactions to the Supreme Court's stay on the High Court's acquittal of the accused. While some voiced hope for eventual justice and the capture of the real culprits, others felt weary of the prolonged legal battle.

title: Deal sealed, but Scotch to stay pricey till 2035
content: Import duties on Scotch and gin in India will decrease from 150% to 75%, but the full effect won't be seen until at least 2035 due to ratification and a phased reduction. While the UK agreed to a minimum import price, consumer price drops may only be around 10% because of state taxes. The move is expected to benefit Indian Made Foreign Liquor manufacturers and boost trade.

title: Opposition protest against Bihar rolls revision stalls House
content: The parliamentary session faced disruptions for the fourth consecutive day due to opposition protests against alleged irregularities in Bihar's electoral rolls. Sonia Gandhi joined the demonstration, demanding accountability from the Election Commission. Despite attempts to proceed with legislative business, both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha were adjourned amidst the uproar, hindering discussions on key bills like the one concerning Scheduled Tribes in Goa's assembly.

title: Delhi To File Review Petition In Supreme Court On Older Vehicle Ban
content: The Delhi government is weighing the option of filing a review petition in the Supreme Court against its order banning overaged petrol and diesel vehicles.

title: "Manhandling Will Not Be Tolerated": Devendra Fadnavis Amid Maharashtra Language Row
content: Weighing in on the language row in Maharashtra, CM Devendra Fadnavis said there is nothing wrong with requesting someone to speak in Marathi. However, he added that his government will not tolerate manhandling anyone in the name of language.

title: What's Behind The Clash Between Thailand And Cambodia; All You Need Know
content: The fighting included gunfire exchanges and shelling and rocket fire, which Thai authorities said killed a Thai soldier and 13 civilians and wounded 14 soldiers and 32 other civilians. Thailand responded with air strikes.

title: "Deeply Saddened": PM Modi Expresses Condolences Over Russia Plane Crash
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has expressed condolences over the tragic plane crash in Russia that claimed 43 lives on board. PM Modi said that India stands in solidarity with Russia and its people.

title: Meghalaya Chief Minister Chairs Review Meeting Amid Assam Eviction Drive
content: Meghalaya Chief Minister Conrad K. Sangma on Thursday chaired a high-level review meeting to assess the state's preparedness and strengthen border vigilance due to the ongoing eviction drive in Assam against illegal immigrants.

title: Israel Condemns France's Recognition Of Palestine As "Aid To Terrorism"
content: Israel's Deputy Prime Minister Yariv Levin on Thursday slammed France's move to recognise a State of Palestine, calling it "a black mark on French history and a direct aid to terrorism".

title: PM Modi Concludes UK Visit After Meeting With King Charles
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday concluded his two-day visit to the UK during which the two countries inked a landmark free trade pact.

title: Macron Says France Will Recognise Palestine As A State
content: French President Emmanuel Macron announced Thursday that France will recognize Palestine as a state, amid snowballing global anger over people starving in Gaza.

title: US Quits Gaza Truce Talks, Blames "Selfish" Hamas For Failure
content: The United States joined Israel on Thursday in pulling its negotiators from Gaza ceasefire talks, with special envoy Steve Witkoff blaming Hamas for failing to reach a deal and saying Washington would "consider alternative options".

title: Such Deals Difficult To Achieve: Sunil Bharti Mittal To NDTV On India-UK Agreement
content: Free trade agreements are not easy to bring about and the one between India and the UK -- signed during Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to the UK -- is a "historic moment" that will benefit both nations, said Sunil Bharti Mittal.

title: Maharashtra Revenue Department Goes Hi-Tech To Ensure Employee Attendance
content: Maharashtra Revenue Department has mandated the use of Face App and geo-fencing systems for all its employees. The plan, in line with a central directive, is meant to ensure that attendance is recorded exclusively from office premises.

title: US Justice Department To Meet Jeffrey Epstein's Ex-Girlfriend On Thursday
content: A top Department of Justice official was expected to meet on Thursday with Ghislaine Maxwell, the imprisoned accomplice of sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, as President Donald Trump struggles to quell fury over his handling of the notorious case.

title: OpenAI Gearing Up To Launch GPT-5 In August: Report
content: Artificial intelligence pioneer OpenAI plans to launch its GPT-5 model as early as August, The Verge reported on Thursday, citing sources familiar with the plans.

title: PM Narendra Modi UK Visit LIVE: PM Modi Meets King Charles In Norfolk, Hours After India-UK Free Trade Agreement Was Signed
content: PM Narendra Modi UK and Maldives Visit LIVE Updates: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is on a four-day visit to the United Kingdom and the Maldives.

title: Family Of Man On Honeymoon Killed In Meghalaya Performs Rituals At Crime Scene
content: The family members of Indore businessman Raja Raghuvanshi visited the site in Meghalaya, where he was murdered allegedly by his wife and three other men on May 23, and performed rituals.

title: 900 Suspected Illegal Migrants Caught In Over 2 Years: Northeast Frontier Railways
content: In a significant development, the Northeast Frontier Railways said over 900 suspected illegal immigrants have been detained at railway stations under its jurisdiction.

title: 48 People Dead After Passenger Plane Crashes In Russias Far East
content: All 48 passengers and crew onboard a passenger plane that crashed in Russia's Far East have died, the head of the country's Amur region said in a statement Thursday.

title: They Kept Getting Promises, But No Road. So These Villagers Built One
content: They kept hearing promises and reassurances and saw no action being taken. But the residents of a small, tribal hamlet deep inside Madhya Pradesh's Barwani district decided they couldn't wait any longer.

title: 'New Momentum In Ties': PM Modi Meets King Charles After Free Trade Deal
content: After the signing of the historic India-UK Free Trade Agreement, Prime Minister Narendra Modi met King Charles III at Sandringham house in the United Kingdom on Thursday.

title: "Your Party": Ex-Labour Leader Jeremy Corbyn Forms New UK Political Party
content: Former leftist Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn announced Thursday he was forming a new political party alongside another ex-member of Britain's ruling party, as the UK's political landscape continues to splinter.

title: 2026 class rankings: Texas surges into the top 5
content: 11 five-star prospects have declared, including two recent commits . the longhorns are making themselves comfortable within SEC country . they landed running back Derrick Cooper, a one-time Georgia commit . Texas flipped ESPN 300 DT James Johnson from the Bulldogs, which helped spur the Horns' leap in the rankings .

title: The Gyökeres-to-Arsenal saga finally looks close to ending. What took so long?
content: arsenal are in a bad spot amid a transfer standoff with Sporting CP for Viktor Gyökeres . the striker's name is still looming over the club's preseason tour to Asia and he isn't even a Gunner yet . he'll shock everyone after an arsenal fan event at an Irish bar .

title: Fresh threads alert: Packers, Saints and more unveil new uniforms for 2025
content: the new "Charger Power" uniforms have been a popular choice in the NFL offseason . the Chargers have also gone back in time, dropping a "modern throwback" all-navy combination . a helmet color is getting love, too, as the new Orleans Saints dropped a new design .

title: Best of the rest: Who's left in NHL free agency?
content: all but seven NHL teams have at least $1 million to spend on their rosters . 11 teams have north of $10 million of cap space . the unrestricted pool is essentially a shallow creek with very few impactful free agents .

title: With Jets' injury history at QB, Fields' minor setback a sigh of relief
content: the new york Jets have suffered major quarterback setbacks for a variety of reasons . in 2023, Aaron Rodgers ruptured his left Achilles on the fourth snap of the season . he was said to have "avoided serious injury and significant missed time"
